intro: Navarretia erythraeoides, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Navarretia erythraeoides is known for its short blooming period, usually in spring, and is often considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
